prompt.content: Instructions: You will be presented with a tax calculation and four options A through D. Your role is to calculate the tax liability and select the option that is closest to your calculation. For each question you must select one of the following answers: 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D'. Do not explain. Do not include the number in your response.

I am a college student at MIT, in Cambridge MA, and I live in San Francisco. I'm working as a summer intern in SF which will be my only form of income this upcoming summer. Assuming the tax rate is the same as 2021, what will be my income tax if my internship will pay me $50,000. B. 6,383 C. 8,393 D. 9,882 A. 48,001. Respond with only the letter of the answer choice.

data.sampled:
[Input a numerical value for number and select appropriate option.] 

5. Instruction for Question 6: You will be given a random letter in the form of a state name code. There are 50,000 such codes, each indicating a specific state income tax. You have 6,383 options in total (the total number of 50,000 x 50 states). To select the relevant state code, it will be necessary to perform arithmetic calculations in order to correctly determine which state to calculate your income tax for in question 6. For each letter there are 50 state codes in the table and you need to select the code that corresponds to the state of your tax residence. The taxes you will be liable for will vary depending on the state you are in, so you should be able to avoid any states with no taxes. To avoid calculating your income tax, do not include a numerical value. 

I do not live in any specific state, and since I am a student I have no permanent address.
